title: Crocus Technology Acquired by Allegro MicroSystems to Accelerate Innovation in TMR Sensing Technology - PR Newswire
summary: Crocus Technology has announced its acquisition by Allegro MicroSystems for $420 million, as both companies focus on advanced Tunnel Magnetoresistance (TMR) sensor technology, particularly for applications in e-mobility and clean energy. The TMR segment is projected to grow rapidly, reaching nearly $1 billion by 2030, driven by automotive and industrial demand. The acquisition aims to enhance Allegro's technology offerings and strengthen market position in magnetic sensors. The transaction is expected to close by the end of 2023, pending regulatory approvals.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the TMR technology focuses on applications in clean energy and e-mobility, contributing to reduced environmental impacts.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the acquisition represents a significant improvement in Allegro's product offerings and capabilities in magnetic sensing technology.

title: Global Net-Zero Energy Buildings (NZEBs) Strategic Research Report 2023-2030: Energy Efficient Buildings in the ... - Yahoo Finance
summary: The global market for Net-Zero Energy Buildings (NZEBs) is projected to grow significantly from $23.3 billion in 2022 to $114.5 billion by 2030, driven by the post-COVID-19 recovery and increased demand for sustainable construction. Key segments include HVAC systems, which are expected to see substantial growth, alongside a focus on various geographic regions. Noteworthy growth rates are anticipated in markets such as China, the U.S., and Europe, as governments emphasize energy-efficient building practices. Overall, NZEBs play a crucial role in achieving decarbonization goals and promoting environmental sustainability.

title: Asia-Pacific HVAC (Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning) Market 2023-2028 Featuring Key Vendors - Daikin ... - Yahoo Finance
summary: The APAC HVAC market is projected to grow from $102.17 billion in 2022 to approximately $148.59 billion by 2028, with a CAGR of 6.4%. The report discusses the increasing demand for HVAC systems, particularly in residential and commercial sectors influenced by urbanization and improved regulations on refrigerants. This transformation includes a shift towards energy-efficient systems utilizing natural refrigerants to reduce environmental impact. Major economies like China and India are key players in this market as construction activities surge.

title: Borivali WEH Witnesses Jangid Group's CP Meet Triumph, Setting the Stage for a Promising Commercial Tower - PR Newswire
summary: Jangid Group has launched a new commercial project on Western Express Highway in Borivali, showcasing contemporary design and functionality. The project emphasizes sustainability by incorporating eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems, appealing to businesses seeking a strategic location in Mumbai. With a proven track record in real estate, Jangid Group aims to redefine the commercial landscape of Borivali through this innovative venture.
